bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 6 (Monday, January 11, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. FOXX:H.R. 243.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 of the UnitedStates Constitution; whereby the Congress shall have Power tolay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts, and Excises, to paythe Debts and provide for the common Defence and generalWelfare of the United States; but all Duties, Imposts andExcises shall be uniform throughout the United States.Furthermore, this bill makes specific changes to existinglaw, in accordance with the Fourteenth Amendment, Section 5,which states that ``No State shall make or enforce any lawwhich shall abridge the privileges or immunities of citizensof the United States; nor shall any State deprive any personof life, liberty, or property, without due process of law;nor deny to any person within its jurisdicition the equalprotection of the laws[Page H123]

item.title: Title X Abortion Provider Prohibition Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Rep. Rosendale Sr., Matthew M. [R-MT-At Large]

summary.text:
Title X Abortion Provider Prohibition Act

This bill prohibits the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) from awarding family planning grants to entities that perform abortions or provide funding to other entities that perform abortions. To receive a grant, an entity must certify it will refrain from those activities during the grant period.

The bill provides exceptions for abortions (1) in cases of rape or incest; or (2) when the life of the woman is in danger due to a physical disorder, injury, or illness. It also exempts hospitals unless they provide funds to non-hospital entities that provide abortions.

HHS must report annually on this prohibition.

bill.title: Title X Abortion Provider Prohibition Act

item.title: Title X Abortion Provider Prohibition Act
Title X Abortion Provider Prohibition Act
To amend title X of the Public Health Service Act to prohibit family planning grants from being awarded to any entity that performs abortions, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
